definition: to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth

sentences.english: Do you think the news media in Hong Kong have any scruple about criticizing the XX Government?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得香港新聞傳媒系批評XX政府既時候有冇顧忌？

sentences.english: Can you explain why you’re not in a position to say?
sentences.chinese: 能解釋一下爲什麼你們不能說麼，是有所顧忌麼？

sentences.english: So every person on the earth can enjoy abundance without any scruple.
sentences.chinese: 所以，地球上的每個人都可以毫無顧忌地享受充裕。

sentences.english: He would have no qualms about using missiles to unleash a nuclear war.
sentences.chinese: 他會毫無顧忌地利用火箭發動一場核戰爭。

sentences.english: "Do you have scruples about that old headman in the temple?"The sea pumice disagrees a way.
sentences.chinese: “你顧忌宮裏那個老頭子？”海浮石不以爲然道。

sentences.english: The insolence and brutality of anger, in the same manner, when we indulge its fury without check or restraint, is, of all objects, the most detestable.
sentences.chinese: 以此類推，無所顧忌傲慢粗魯的憤怒是最令人憎惡的。

sentences.english: I felt entirely free and unconcerned.
sentences.chinese: 我感到完全自由，毫無顧忌。

sentences.english: Dog day zhen see night come and dont begin, can not help but have scruples.
sentences.chinese: 天貞見夜犬來了又不動手，不禁有所顧忌。

sentences.english: The nonage can not enter bar to not have scruples about inside the scope by them.
sentences.chinese: 未成年人不能進酒吧可不在他們顧忌範圍內。

sentences.english: Chen MengFei feeling, no scruple of supplication.
sentences.chinese: 陳超顧忌孟菲感受，沒有再同意欣兒的懇求。

sentences.english: The frank espousal of a policy of annihilating opponents and the murders committed in the pursuance of it have given rise to an opposition movement.
sentences.chinese: 毫無顧忌地滅絕反對派，以執行公務的名義進行謀殺。

sentences.english: But the Japanese government did not dare to take any further action for fear of reaction from China.
sentences.chinese: 由於顧忌中國的反應，日本政府未敢輕舉妄動。

sentences.english: There are no limits;you just have to know what would excite her.
sentences.chinese: 你不用顧忌什麼，只要知曉什麼能讓她興奮就好。

sentences.english: The Chinese actually have a great hesitance in general to face death as it is.
sentences.chinese: 中國人一般在談及死亡的時候有很多顧忌。

sentences.english: Actually i as soon as put out a hand may hug you, but i have too much scruples.
sentences.chinese: 事實上我一伸出手就可以攬住你，但系我有太多顧忌。

sentences.english: People feel no qualms about pushing whenever it becomes crowded.
sentences.chinese: 人們在感到擁擠時毫無顧忌地亂推亂搡。

definition: to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
